creator: philip@dmind.com
text:
Using 1.2.2, importNode() worked when the node being imported
defined a namespace like: 

<blah:TheElement xmlns:blah="http://www.something.com/"/>

and it was being imported into a document:
<blah:Document xmlns:blah="http://www.something.com/"/>

would result in:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<blah:Document xmlns:blah="http://www.something.com/"><blah:TheElement 
xmlns:blah="http://www.something.com/"/></blah:Document>

Now, I get:
org.w3c.dom.DOMException: DOM003 Namespace error

It appears that I can't have a namespace definition at all in the node to be 
imported.  This doesn't seem right to me considering that namespaces should be 
able to be defined at any point in a document.

Thanks,
Philip
This has been reported several times already, and is fixed. Please check first!
creator: lehors@apache.org
